AssetClass.title: Asset Class
AssetClass.description: As defined by CFI code: ISO 10962 (2015); Character #2

InstrumentType.title: Instrument Type
InstrumentType.description: As defined by CFI code: ISO 10962 (2015); Character #1

UseCase.title: Product
UseCase.description: Unique label that defines the product

Level.description: Label assigned to the UPI to describe its level in the hierarchy
Level.title: Level

Underlying.title: Underlier Type
Underlying.description: Indicates the type of underlying asset or entity on which the product is based.

UnderlierIDSource.title: Underlier ID Source
UnderlierIDSource.description: The origin, or publisher, of the associated underlier ID.

elaboration.ISIN: ISIN code of the underlying instrument
elaboration.FIGI: FIGI code of the underlying instrument
elaboration.CUSIP: CUSIP code of the underlying instrument
elaboration.SEDOL: SEDOL code of the underlying instrument

UnderlierID.title: Underlier ID
UnderlierID.description: An identifier that can be used to determine the asset(s), index (indices) or benchmark underlying a contract or, in the case of a foreign exchange derivative, identification of the currency pair or index

UnderlierIDSource.title: Underlier ID Source
UnderlierIDSource.description: The origin, or publisher, of the associated underlier ID.

elaboration.LEI: In case the instrument is referring to an issuer, rather than to one single instrument, the LEI code of the Issuer

UnderlierID.title: Underlier ID
UnderlierID.description: An identifier that can be used to determine the asset(s), index (indices) or benchmark underlying a contract or, in the case of a foreign exchange derivative, identification of the currency pair or index

ContractSpecification.title: Contract Specification
ContractSpecification.description: The name of an existing document or reference that provides standard terms and conditions to be applied to the contract having the underlying asset or benchmark identified by the Underlier ID and Underlier ID source for which the UPI is assigned.

elaboration.AsiaSovereign: Matrix Transaction Type of ASIA SOVEREIGN.
elaboration.AustraliaSovereign: Matrix Transaction Type of AUSTRALIA SOVEREIGN.
elaboration.EmergingEuropeanAndMiddleEasternSovereig: Matrix Transaction Type of EMERGING EUROPEAN AND MIDDLE EASTERN SOVEREIGN.
elaboration.JapanSovereign: Matrix Transaction Type of JAPAN SOVEREIGN.
elaboration.LatinAmericaSovereign: Matrix Transaction Type of LATIN AMERICA SOVEREIGN.
elaboration.NewZealandSovereign: Matrix Transaction Type of NEW ZEALAND SOVEREIGN.
elaboration.SingaporeSovereign: Matrix Transaction Type of SINGAPORE SOVEREIGN.
elaboration.StandardAsiaSovereign: Matrix Transaction Type of STANDARD ASIA SOVEREIGN.
elaboration.StandardAustraliaSovereign: Matrix Transaction Type of STANDARD AUSTRALIA SOVEREIGN.
elaboration.StandardEmergingEuropeanAndMiddleEastern: Matrix Transaction Type of STANDARD EMERGING EUROPEAN AND MIDDLE EASTERN SOVEREIGN.
elaboration.StandardJapanSovereign: Matrix Transaction Type of STANDARD JAPAN SOVEREIGN.
elaboration.StandardLatinAmericaSovereign: Matrix Transaction Type of STANDARD LATIN AMERICA SOVEREIGN.
elaboration.StandardNewZealandSovereign: Matrix Transaction Type of STANDARD NEW ZEALAND SOVEREIGN.
elaboration.StandardSingaporeSovereign: Matrix Transaction Type of STANDARD SINGAPORE SOVEREIGN.
elaboration.StandardWesternEuropeanSovereign: Matrix Transaction Type of STANDARD WESTERN EUROPEAN SOVEREIGN.
elaboration.SukukSovereign: Matrix Transaction Type of SUKUK SOVEREIGN.
elaboration.WesternEuropeanSovereign: Matrix Transaction Type of WESTERN EUROPEAN SOVEREIGN.

DebtSeniority.title: Debt Seniority
DebtSeniority.description: Indicates the seniority of the debt, or debt basket or index underlying a derivative

DeliveryType.title: Delivery Type
DeliveryType.description: The Delivery Type as defined by CFI code: ISO 10962 (2015)

elaboration.CASH: the discharge of an obligation by payment or receipt of a net cash amount instead of payment or delivery by both parties
elaboration.PHYS: the meeting of a settlement obligation under a derivative contract through the receipt or delivery of the actual underlying instrument(s) instead of through cash settlement
elaboration.OPTL: an independently administered synthetic auction process on a set of defined deliverable obligations that sets a reference final price that can be used to facilitate cash settlement of all covered transactions following a credit event
